text: Brendan Halligan (5 July 1936 – 9 August 2020) was an Irish economist and politician. He was founder and president of the Institute of International and European Affairs (IIEA). He was president of the Ireland China Institute. He was also a Board Member of Mainstream Renewable Power. He was General Secretary of the Labour Party, a Teachta Dála (TD), a Senator, and a Member of the European Parliament (MEP). He was born in Dublin. He died on 9 August 2020, aged 84. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Irish businesspeople Category:Economists Category:Politicians from Dublin Category:MEPs for Ireland
title: Brendan Halligan
